result.execSummary:
The defendant Willard J. Strese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge  plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--complete Certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol, per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores, per Agent

Arresting Agency: FAPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due. 

 Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

timeConds.notes:

04/20/15: The Court grants Mr. Strese the request to report for his jail sentence on April 23, 2015 at 5:00pm. The Jail term is with work release privleges.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Overpayment of copy fees refunded to Brantmeier Law Office.
Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 1:49pm [mo]
Defendant Willard J. Strese in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance and notes there is no victim present in courtroom.

On the Defendant's 4/10/15 Motion to Modify Sentence:
--The Court and Mr. Strese discuss the letter Mr. Strese sent to the Court regarding this Motion
--The State does not object changing Mr. Strese's report date.
--The Court grants Mr. Strese the request to report for his jail sentence on April 23, 2015 at 5:00pm.

The Judgement of Conviction should be amended to reflect this date. The Jail term is with work release privleges. 
recess: 1:55pm
Hearing to be scheduled for defendants request to modify sentence
Motion hearing on April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Request to reschedule jail start date resubmitted by the def, with proof of copy to the State

CLERKS NOTE:
In response to the Courts letter on 04-14-2015 , the defendant came into the Clerk of Courts office. He took a copy of his letter and took a copy upstairs and filed it with the State. 
He came down to the office with the receive stamped letter and requested to resubmit this letter to the court.
Defendant resubmits letter w/proof of service of the State
Courts response to the defendants request to change report date to work//exparte approach to the court is not proper
Letter from the defendant ref report date for jail
Criminal case settlement/conflict review worksheet/huber/work release notification

Case called at 9:34am [mo]
Defendant Willard J. Strese in court.  ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance   
Right to Counsel given; Mr. Strese waives right to counsel
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Strese and that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County Assistant District Attorney, ADA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Strese.The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statement
ADA Hall gives sentencing arguments
Statement made by Mr. Strese

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to serve 7 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  5/1/15 at   7:00 am.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete Certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol, per Agent
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores, per Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:10:01am
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Status conference on March 31, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 10:34 am [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Mark Fremgen presiding for BrII]
Defendant Willard J. Strese in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Strese indicates that he would like to proceed today without counsel
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant; Court finds waiver is voluntary & knowledgable

Court continues $350 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Lori Vogel
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of any alcohol
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
Recess: 10:40 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/18/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 3/31/15 at 9:30 am - Send notices
